A letter from Common Cause, Democracy 21 and other good government groups said the public financing system has served the country and presidential candidates of both parties well for most of its 35-year existence and the system only began to decline when campaign costs outstripped the public financing provided to participating candidates. losing engineers frustrated by a shift in the culture that normally happens when a company gets as big as Google is," Seth Harris , technology practice head at Tim Cook Associates, told the E-Commerce Times. Engineers fear the company is not moving fast enough and say it's harder to get time with leaders; many have already made money with Google and see opportunities to move to big private tech firms expected to go public in 12 to 18 months. There has also been talk of tension between Eric Schmidt and Page on competing priorities, Seth Harris added, with Eric Schmidt emphasizing the need to protect margins and Page pushing for more innovation.
